main event: On July 2nd, 1958, a civilian reported sighting a round, yellow-white object with fuzzy outlines moving from 235 degrees azimuth to 265 degrees azimuth, which was concluded to be a slow meteor by the U.S. Air Force.
interesting points: The object was described as flat and rounded at both ends with fuzzy outlines, and it was moving much too fast for an aircraft according to the observer.
The observer's first impression was that of a satellite or meteor, indicating that it resembled known celestial objects.
The observer estimated seeing the object for 6 seconds and was fairly certain about their observation.
The sighting location was between Springfield and Enon, Ohio, and the observer was driving home from work at the time of the sighting.
The report included a questionnaire with detailed questions about the sighting, including the characteristics, motion, and estimated size of the observed object.
sighted object: round, yellow-white object with fuzzy outlines
